intro: Odontarrhena filiformis, commonly known as the slender grass or narrow-leaved grass, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 10 cm in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Odontarrhena filiformis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
